listing.description: The property  An exceptional property in a lovely tucked away position at the end of a long tree lined drive on the South Eastern outskirts of the town. The main house has been updated to a very high standard and the coach house has been converted to a similarly high standard making it a very attractive annexe. As might be expected with a house of this era, the ceiling heights are great and the dining room is a splendid room with double height ceiling overlooked by the galleried landing.The gardens and grounds which extend to four acres are a particularly attractive feature of the property and comprise manicured lawns interspersed with some magnificent mature trees and an area of woodland.About the area  Ipswich is set on the estuary of the River Orwell and has undergone an extensive gentrification programme in recent years, mainly around the waterfront, and has become a popular "commuter" town – Ipswich has a main line rail link to London's Liverpool Street (journey time of sixty-five minutes). Ipswich is the county town of Suffolk and offers a wide variety of shopping, commercial and recreational facilities. There is an excellent choice of schooling within both the state and private sectors. Ipswich has access to various road networks including the A12 to the South with links to London and the M25 and via the A14 to The Midlands and the M11.Services  We understand that mains services include water, electricity, gas and water connected. Private drainage. Ipswich Borough Council tax band G.
listing.short_description: An exceptional 7 bedroom property in a lovely tucked away position at the end of a long tree lined drive on the south eastern outskirts of the town. The gardens and grounds are a particularly attractive feature of the property extending to 4 acres (sts). Planning permission has been granted for the addition of an orangery. The property boasts space, character and has been finished to a high standard.

listing.letting_fees:
We are required by law to disclose all agency fees when letting a property through Nicholas Estates Ltd.
Please read the below schedule to ensure that you are fully informed of the costs involved before you make a decisions to proceed:

On application:
£200.00 + VAT (£240.00) - referencing fee, set up fee and contribution to the tenancy agreement for 1 adult applicant
£100.00 + VAT (£120.00) - each additional adult applicant

If applicable:
£400.00 + VAT (£480.00) - company tenant
£100.00 + VAT (£120.00) - each guarantor
£25.00 + VAT (£30.00) for changing any terms that have already been agreed (e.G. Changing tenancy start date)

Prior to moving in you need to pay:
• Admin & Referencing - As outlined above
• First months rent payment
• Tenancy deposit - Usually 1 months rent if unfurnished and 1.5 month’s rent but if furnished. In certain circumstances a large deposit may be required i.E. Pets

On going:
£75.00 + VAT (£90.00) - Inventory check out & Property inspection fee
£50.00 + VAT (£60.00) - Fixed term renewal administration fee

Acceptable methods of payment for first months rent and deposit:
• Debit card
• Credit card

Please note: There is a surcharge of 3% for payment with a credit card or an overseas debit card

Monthly rent payments are to made via standing order from your bank
listing.description: Coming soon - register your interest nowguide price £1,250,000 - £1,350,000Nicholas Estates are proud to bring to the market for sale a bespoke development of two imposing 4000 square foot town houses located in a sought after Christchurch Park address. The building, originally a boarding school, dates back to 1863 and has been superbly converted in to these beautiful, individually designed four storey family homes offering versatile living spaces with a unique blend of period and modern features, having undergone a painstaking and meticulous renovation throughout taking over 2 1/2 years by the renowned, award winning local developers James Francis Homes Limited.This impressive development offers buyers the opportunity to choose all kitchen and bathroom fittings & fixtures, are set in generous plots with off road parking for up to 10 cars and double garages, are less than 5 minutes walking distance from Ipswich School and Christchurch park and in close proximity to the town centre, railway station, waterfront and A12/ A14.
listing.short_description: Coming soon - register your interest now  guide price £1,250,000 - £1,350,000  Nicholas Estates are proud to bring to the market for sale a bespoke development of two imposing 4000 square foot town houses located in a sought after Christchurch Park address. The building, original (cont.)

listing.description: HouseSimple is pleased to present this property in Ipswich.Located within a 15-minute walk from Ipswich town centre, this 11-bedroom townhouse used to be a Georgian rectory, historically used for people working away from home for the church.The building is unique and has no building restrictions at all which would enable development if wanted.The house has a garden which is walled and features a courtyard and pond. There is also a downstairs lounge, a bar/room and a breakfast dining area. The car park has been recently tarmacked. A large cellar sits underneath the establishment which is used for storage at this time.There are several restaurants within a 5-minute walk. Schools are very close to the building as well, including the prestigious Ipswich School.Bentley Tower is ideally situated within easy reach of many of the town’s main attractions, including Ipswich Football ground, Ipswich Museum, The Wolsey Theatre, The John Mills Theatre, Christchurch Park, Christchurch Mansion and Suffolk Records Office.
listing.short_description:
HouseSimple is pleased to present this property in Ipswich.

Located within a 15-minute walk from Ipswich town centre, this 11-bedroom townhouse used to be a Georgian rectory, historically used for people working away from home for the church.

The building is unique and has no building restrictions at all which would enable development if wanted.

The house has a garden which is walled and features a courtyard and pond. There is also a downstairs lounge, a bar/room and a breakfast dining area. The car park has been recently tarmacked. A large cellar sits underneath the establishment which is used for storage at this time.

There are several restaurants within a 5-minute walk. Schools are very close to the building as well, including the prestigious Ipswich School.

Bentley Tower is ideally situated within easy reach of many of the town’s main attractions, including Ipswich Football ground, Ipswich Museum, The Wolsey Theatre, The John Mills Theatre, Christchurch Park, Christchurch Mansion and Suffolk Records Office.

listing.description: Ascot Estate Agency are delighted to bring to the market a unique opportunity to acquire a 13 room hmo situated on the northern approaches to Ipswich. This extensive property would make an excellent investment purchase and is situated in one of Ipswich's best locations, within walking distance of Christchurch Park, and the town centre with an extensive range of shops and other local amenities. The property boasts a secure intercom entrance, communal gardens, off road parking, double glazing and central heating.Each flat is currently tenanted and benefits from a spacious bedroom, fitted kitchens with white goods, open plan lounge/dining area and shower room; all of which are maintained in good order. There is residents parking to the front of the property, and attractive communal gardens.LocationIpswich town centre is within walking distance, and as previously mentioned, offers a range of commercial, educational, and leisure facilities, including shops, schools, bars, restaurants, University of Suffolk, and Ipswich Mainline Railway station which offers frequent links to London Liverpool Street.This unique investment opportunity benefits from a yearly rental income of £43,680 broken down as follows;Flat no. Monthly rent = (x12) Yearly incomeFlat 1. £300 x12 = £3,600Flat 2. £250 x12 = £3,000Flat 3. £285 x12 = £3,420Flat 4. £310 x12 = £3,720Flat 5. £260 x12 = £3,120Flat 6. £195 x12 = £2,340Flat 7. £300 x12 = £3,600Flat 8. £250 x12 = £3,000Flat 9. £250 x12 = £3,000Flat 10. £240 x12 = £2,880Flat 11. £350 x12 = £4,200Flat 12. £350 x 12 = £4,200Basement Flat. £300 x12 = £3,600Total yearly income: £43,680
listing.short_description: Unique opportunity to acquire a 13 bedroom hmo situated close to christchurch park benefitting from communal gardens, off road parking, open plan living areas, tenants in situ, within walking distance to town centre. Annual rental income exceeding £43,000

listing.agent_address: Alton Business Centre, Valley Lane, Ipswich
listing.letting_fees:
Landlord fees and charges

What we charge you depends a lot on what kind of property you’re letting. But here is a breakdown of all our charges to give you an idea of what to expect.
Your local team will talk you through our Terms of Business, the services we offer and what your fees will be.

Letting, renewal and receiving rent: 10.5% + VAT (12% inc VAT)* of rent for the whole time your tenant stays in the property. We’ll:

Find a tenant
Discuss local market conditions
Advise on preparing your property for letting
Keep you up to date on compliance and health & safety
Put up a ‘To let’ board
Market the property and advertise on relevant portals
Arrange and accompany viewings
Collect and hold the deposit
Ask tenants to set up rent payments and pass monies on
Make any necessary hmrc deduction
Chase late rent payments
Discuss renewal or termination with you before the end of the tenancy
* Minimum Fee London Region £1500 + VAT (£1800 inc VAT)
* Minimum Fee Other Regions £1000 + VAT (£1200 inc VAT)

Letting, renewal, receiving rent and management: 12.5% + VAT (15% inc VAT)* of rent for the whole time your tenant stays in the property (24% inc VAT for short lets)

In addition to the letting, renewal and receiving rent services, we'll:
Deal with day-to-day management including repairs
Give utility suppliers meter readings when the tenancy starts and ends
Hold a set of keys throughout the tenancy
Hold a working fund and make payments
Organise the following safety checks: Gas safety record, electrical safety tests, smoke and carbon monoxide alarms
Visit the property at least once a year
Provide an emergency out of hours service
Manage the end of tenancy process and deposit return
* Minimum Fee London Region £2,500 + VAT (£3,000 inc VAT)
* Minimum Fee Other Regions £2,000 + VAT (£2,400 inc VAT)

Management-only service

Handover £500: + VAT (£600 inc VAT)

Fees for the whole time your tenant stays in the property: 8% + VAT (9.6% inc VAT)

* Minimum Fee £1800 (inc VAT)

Vacant management (before you let or between tenancies)

This depends on what you need: A minimum of £100 + VAT (£120 inc VAT) per month

Pre-letting service (visual check)

£500 + VAT (£600 inc VAT) plus reasonable travel expenses

Sale of property (including sales progression) 2% + VAT (2.4% inc VAT) of the agreed sale price

Extra optional and non-optional fees and charges Fee excl. VAT Fee inc. VAT
Tenancy paperwork – Long lets (landlords share) £350 £420
Land registry £8 £9.60
Deposit registration £25 per annum £30 per annum
Transferring deposit to landlord during tenancy £100 £120
Helping with deposit adjudication £100 per hour £120 per hour
Selective licensing application handling £250 £300
Selective licensing annual holding £100 £120
Making an inventory e.G. Three-bed unfurnished £180 £216
Inventory ‘check-in’ e.G. Three-bed unfurnished £150 £180
Inventory arrangement (included with management service) £50 per appointment £60 per appointment
hmo visits and/or any additional property visits £100 per visit £120 per visit
Quarterly return to hmrc £120 quarterly £144 quarterly
Copy statements £25 per copy £30 per copy
Arranging works or refurbishment over £1000 10% of net cost 12% of net cost
Insurance claims £100 per hour £120 per hour
Tenancy renewal paperwork (landlords share) £100 £120
Cancelling a let before the tenant moves in £291.70 plus out of pocket costs £350 plus out of pocket costs
Service of notices:
Serve Section 13 Notice £41.70 £50
Serve Section 21 Notice (included with management service) £41.70 £50
Attending court £100 per hour £120 per hour
Attending court (Director) £200 per hour £240 per hour
Interest on unpaid commission or other monies 4% above the base rate of Barclays Bank plc £30
Making a payment outside the UK £25
Making a same day payment in the UK £25 £30
listing.description: *no onward chain* Woodcock & Son . This six-bedroom mid-century home is situated in a highly desirable location just a moment from Christchurch Park and only a short walk from some of Ipswich’s best primary, secondary and independent schools. The well-proportioned rooms offer elegant accommodation, with spacious reception rooms on the ground floor and six generous bedrooms, as well as a sauna, two bathrooms and a shower room on the first floor. The property is home to a generous driveway, back garden, car port and garage.
listing.short_description: *no onward chain* Woodcock & Son . This six-bedroom mid-century home is situated in a highly desirable location just a moment from Christchurch Park and only a short walk from some of Ipswich’s best primary, secondary and independent schools. The well-proportioned rooms offer elegant accommodation, with spacious reception rooms on the ground floor and six generous bedrooms, as well as a sauna, two bathrooms and a shower room on the first floor. The property is home to a generous driveway, back garden, car port and garage.

listing.description: Plot 2 .... In the valuer's opinion, this is an exciting opportunity to purchase one of two spacious, brand new six bedroom three storey detached family homes with a 6 year warranty in Elton Park, Ipswich.The ground floor comprises of a large entrance hallway, lounge, dining room, kitchen/breakfast room with bi-fold doors opening on to the raised terrace area, utility room with larder and cloakroom. The first floor consists of a master bedroom with dressing area and ensuite. There are three further bedrooms on this floor, one with ensuite shower room along with a family bathroom. There are two further bedrooms on the second floor along with an additional family bathroom.There are front and rear gardens along with shared driveway providing off road parking leading to the integral double garage.Elton Park is an unmade, horseshoe shaped private road located off Hadleigh Road, opposite Chantry Park only 5 minutes drive from the town centre and is situated approximately 1 mile to the West of Ipswich the county town of Suffolk which stands at the head of the River Orwell providing easy access to the region's main road network (A12 and A14) which link with the East Coast Ports, the Midlands and London's M25 motorway. The towns of Colchester, Bury St Edmunds and Felixstowe are also easily accessible.Front gardenFull details to follow. listing.description: Century 21 are excited to present this rare opportunity to purchase one of two brand new builds in a prestigious location to the south west of Ipswich. Options available for negotiation including decor, carpets and tiling. Accommodation on offer includes entrance hall way, dining area or study, large lounge with brick fireplace, high spec fitted kitchen diner with bi folding doors onto raised decking, utility room, downstairs cloakroom, six double bedrooms, two en suites and two family bathrooms. Externally there is a sweeping driving providing ample off road parking, double garage, raised flower beds, side access to rear and generous size rear garden with a stream running behind. All offered with no onward chain this property must be viewed to be appreciated.Elton Park is a prestigious and much sought after private road to the south western side of Ipswich.
